page.title: 01FORD AREA NORTHUMBERLAND
page.content: 10 FORD AREA. NORTHUMBERLAND. 15 The land is part of a privately owned estate with one small village, a castle and some farms. Some farms are farmed by the estate and others are let to tenant farmers. There is one dairy farm and the others are mixed farms. With changing farming methods many of the houses are not needed for farm workers, so many house retired workers. The estate employ people to maintain all open areas around the village which means it is always very attractive. It is a well-wooded area and the estate forestry department is an important part of the estate work. The castle is used as a field studies centre by Northumberland Education Authority. During the summer months many day tourists visit the area.
